alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 6:36PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...New Haven and Middlesex counties in southern Connecticut. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 636 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will be capable of causing urban and small stream flooding. - Rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that could experience minor flooding include... New Haven, Meriden, Middletown, Wallingford, Shelton, Guilford, East Hampton, Durham, Chester, Hamden, Cheshire, Branford, North Haven, Seymour, North Branford, Cromwell, Orange, Derby, Portland and East Haddam. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
